comment._content: Harry "Steamboat" Johnson, a somewhat legendary minor league baseball umpire, who authored the book <u>Standing the Gaff: The Life and Hard Times of a Minor League Umpire</u>, published in 1935, and republished as recently as 2005.  While best known as a minor league umpire, Johnson did work one solitary season in the major league, in 1914 in the National League - as captured here in this photo in the Polo Grounds.
